greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least integers, starting with 1, so ascending descending base exponent transforms all triprimes.
comment: This is the triprime analogy to A113320.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(1) = 1. For n > 1: a(n) = min {n > 0: Sum_{i=1..n} a(i)^a(n-i+1) is a triprime}. a(n) = min {n > 0: Sum_{i=1..n} a(i)^a(n-i+1) in A014612}.
mathematica: p3[n_] := PrimeOmega[n] == 3; inve[w_] := Total[w^Reverse[w]]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Block[{k = 0}, While[! p3[ inve@ Append[ Array[a, n - 1], ++k]]]; k]; Array[a, 75] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Jun 13 2016 *)
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Jan 10 2006
ext: Corrected and extended by _Giovanni Resta_, Jun 13 2016
